articles.author: Kylie Maclellan, William James, Sarah Young
articles.description: Britain's new prime minister Keir Starmer pledged on Friday to use his massive electoral majority to rebuild the country, saying he wanted to take the heat out of politics after years of upheaval and strife.
articles.title: New PM Starmer pledges to rebuild Britain after years of chaos

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl, a Category 2 storm, made landfall in Mexico's top tourist destinations early on Friday, triggering a red alert in the region following its deadly trail of destruction across several Caribbean islands.
articles.title: Hurricane Beryl makes landfall in Mexican coast

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Efforts to secure a ceasefire and hostage release in Gaza were gathering momentum on Friday after Hamas made a revised proposal on the terms of a deal and Israel said it would resume stalled negotiations.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire hopes rise as Israel says it will resume stalled negotiations

articles.author: Anna Voitenko, Alina Smutko
articles.description: Russian forces are advancing slowly but surely in Toretsk, pummelling the devastated eastern Ukrainian town night and day with rockets, artillery fire and air attacks.
articles.title: Time running out for Ukrainians fleeing Russia's advance

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: The recriminations and jostling for top positions among Britain's Conservative lawmakers began long before Thursday's crushing election defeat to Labour that some party figures said left the party facing the prospect of a decade out of power.
articles.title: UK's Conservatives face leadership "bloodbath" as party seeks new direction

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iranians will vote in a run-off presidential election on Friday amid voter apathy and heightened regional tensions.
articles.title: Iranians vote in run-off presidential election amid widespread apathy

articles.author: Rajesh Prabhuswamy
articles.description: Fixing India's trade imbalance with Russia and securing the discharge of Indians misled into fighting in the Ukraine war will be among Prime Minister Narendra Modi's priorities during talks in Moscow next week, a top official said on Friday.
articles.title: Modi to focus on trade imbalance, Indian soldiers in talks with Putin

articles.author: Dominique Vidalon, Ingrid Melander
articles.description: Parties across the political spectrum urged French voters to vote massively on Sunday to tilt the outcome either way as opinion polls forecast the far-right would be the largest party but fall short of an absolute majority.
articles.title: Go vote, parties tell French voters ahead of cliffhanger runoff

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kenyan President William Ruto on Friday pledged spending cuts totalling 177 billion shillings ($1.39 billion) in the fiscal year that started in July, after weeks of nationwide protests that forced him to scrap planned tax hikes.
articles.title: Kenya's Ruto pledges spending cuts after nationwide protests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli delegation led by spy chief David Barnea left Doha after meeting with Qatari mediators about Gaza ceasefire talks, a source with knowledge of the talks told Reuters on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli delegation left Doha after meeting Qatari mediators over Gaza ceasefire talks -source to Reuters
